newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Spokesman for ailing Yeltsin to brief newsmen.
newsitem.headline: Spokesman for ailing Yeltsin to brief newsmen.

text.p: A spokesman for Russian President Boris Yeltsin, currently being prepared for heart surgery, has called a news briefing for 1.15 p.m. (0915 GMT) on Tuesday.
The Kremlin press service said no specific theme had been set for the briefing by Sergei Yastrzhembsky, the president's chief press spokesman.

Yeltsin has spent the last four days in hospital in Moscow undergoing tests prior to planned heart surgery. No date for the operation, which doctors have said will be a fairly straightforward bypass operation, has been announced.
Yeltsin's health problems have sparked speculation over who will run the country, and take control of Russia's huge nuclear arsenal, while the president has the operation.
